description: Borrowed from Middle French admiration, or directly from Latin admīrātiō, from prefix ad- (“to, towards”) + mīrō (“I look at”) + -ātiō. Compare the verb admire, and US dialectal terms miration and mirate.

nouns.description: admiration (countable and uncountable, plural admirations) #*: All Heaven, what this might mean, and whither tend,Wondering;

entries.meaning: A positive emotion including wonder and approbation; the regarding of another as being wonderful
examples: They looked at the landscape in admiration.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Wondering or questioning (without any particular positive or negative attitude to the subject).
